The grid is completely surrounded by water, and there is exactly \none island (i.e., one or more connected land cells).\nThe island doesn't have \"lakes\", meaning the water inside isn't connected to the water around the island. One cell is a square with \nside length 1. The grid is rectangular, width and height don't exceed 100. Determine the perimeter of the island.\nrow == grid.length\ncol == grid[i].length\n1 <= row, col <= 100\ngrid[i][j] is 0 or 1.\nThere is exactly one island in grid.\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    int islandPerimeter(vector<vector<int>>& grid) {\n        if(grid.empty()) \n            return 0;\n        int m = grid.size();\n        int n = grid[0].size();\n        int area = 0;\n        int conn = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<m; i++) {\n            for(int j=0; j<n; j++) {\n                if(grid[i][j] == 1) {\n                    area++;\n                    if(i-1>=0 && grid[i-1][j]==1)\n                        conn++;\n                    if(j-1>=0 && grid[i][j-1]==1)\n                        conn++;                    \n                    if(i+1<m && grid[i+1][j]==1)\n                        conn++;                    \n                    if(j+1<n && grid[i][j+1]==1)\n                        conn++;                        \n                }\n            }\n        }\n        return area*4-conn;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"island-perimeter","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
